title: Sampler, May 28, 1800
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross stitch on plain weave foundation
inscribed: Louisa Figgiss Perren Finish'd this sampler May 28, 1800 Aged 11 Years
provenance: Ex. coll. Fraser-Martin. Purchased from Miss Annie Grant, England, 1924
creditline: Gift of Myra M. and William H. Mathers
description: Embroidered entirely in black on a white ground. Bands of alphabets and verses, and an inscription, are separated by floral cross borders. Isolated motifs of trees, urns of flowers, and birds are symmetrically arranged on either side. The composition is framed on four sides with a stylized strawberry vine border.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, May 28, 1800.
May 28, 1800. Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross stitch on plain weave foundation. Gift of Myra M. and William H. Mathers. 2008-31-8.
